channel.title: How do I change player access levels!
channel.description: God I have been searching forever!!! I know I have to change something to 3 but where!?!?! I am using ddsscape. Thanks for your help.

item.title: How do I change player access levels!
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“djspanke, post:9, topic:285832”][quote author=Natey link=topic=378024.msg2844377#msg2844377 date=1246188148]

Alright but how do I make an account an administrator? And thank you as well
[/quote]Find your “characters” folder, make an account in game then log out, open the .txt document that has your name on it, find ‘player rights = 0’ without quotes and change the ‘0’ to a ‘1’ without quotes, and you should really learn Java before you come back here.

1=mod
2=admin
3=owner/co-owner
4=hidden owner/co-owner[/quote]My bad I wrote this when I was tired.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I change player access levels!

[/quote]Find your “characters” folder, make an account in game then log out, open the .txt document that has your name on it, find ‘player rights = 0’ without quotes and change the ‘0’ to a ‘1’ without quotes, and you should really learn Java before you come back here.[/quote]
1=mod

3=owner/co-owner

item.title: How do I change player access levels!
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“Overhead, post:7, topic:285832”]Alright but how do I make an account an administrator? And thank you as well :D[/quote]Find your “characters” folder, make an account in game then log out, open the .txt document that has your name on it, find ‘player rights = 0’ without quotes and change the ‘0’ to a ‘1’ without quotes, and you should really learn Java before you come back here.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I change player access levels!
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

So, lets say that you want to make ::ipban or ::ipbanuser for admins which players rights are 2 on a 317, all you have to do is go into client.java search for “if(command” without quotes and look for the commands with the rights you want to change and change them to 1,2,3, or 4 save and compile.

Read full topic
